task_unit_dag.relationship_reasoning: Accessing and modifying the watchlist inherently involves searching, browsing, filtering, and adding items to it. These actions are necessary steps to achieve the broader goal of managing the watchlist.

Navigating and adding top-rated items to the wishlist can involve browsing through categories, filtering items, and selecting specific types of items, which are all sub-tasks under the broader goal of adding top-rated items.
Filtering and adding places to a named wishlist involves filtering options and browsing categories, which are necessary steps to select and add items to a specific wishlist.
Browsing new releases and adding them to the wishlist involves browsing categories and adding multiple items, which are sub-tasks under the broader goal of updating the wishlist with new releases.

validation.acyclic_reasoning: The constructed DAG reflects a hierarchical structure where each parent task unit encompasses its child task units without any cyclic dependencies, ensuring a logical flow of task objectives.
